intro: Chionolaena lavandulacea, commonly known as silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Its compact growth habit and attractive appearance make it popular in gardens and landscaping.
